did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: Virginia A Guide to the Virginia Home Economics Association: Committee for the Stadardization of Consumer Goods 1930-1936
did.abstract: Collection contains correspondence and reports of the Committee for the Standardization of Consumer Goods.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Virginia Home Economics Association: Committee for the Standardization of Consumer Goods Records must be obtained from the Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia Home Economics Association: Committee for the Standardization of Consumer Goods Records, Ms63-001, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Virginia Home Economics Association: Committee for the Standardization of Consumer Goods Records commenced in September 2006 and was completed in 2006.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: In the early twentieth-century, seven women including Mary Ledger Moffett founded the Virginia Home Economics Association. This organization's Committee for the Standardization of Consumer Goods, chaired during the 1930s by Ilena M. Bailey, focused on the creation of quality standards for products such as blankets, sheets, pillowcases, stockings, canned food, and refrigerators.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of correspondence and reports from 1930 to 1936 of Ilena M. Bailey, home economics researcher at Virginia Tech and chairperson of the Committee for the Standardization of Consumer Goods. Materials include correspondence with department store managers, government agencies and women's organizations.
